text: 157 (one hundred fifty-seven) is a whole number. It comes after 156 and before 158. == Mathematics == *157 is the 37th prime number. It is a balanced prime, because it is exactly in the middle of the prime before it (151) and the prime after it (163). *157 is also an emirp, which means it is a prime number that becomes a different prime when its digits are reversed. The reverse of 157 is 751, which is also prime. Category:Integers Category:Prime numbers
title: 157 (number)
